definition: broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: You just hate waste, and when someone else costs you dearly you see red.
sentences.chinese: 你厌恶浪费，如果别人让你大肆破费，你会发怒。

sentences.english: Find the approximate percent decrease in the cost per minute of a long-distance call?
sentences.chinese: 请得出长途电话每分钟破费的大约增加的百分率？

sentences.english: But I think it would be a good birthday present…
sentences.chinese: 多谢先，咁破费呀，我十月生日，你储定钱刚刚好。

sentences.english: You can buy meaningful gifts that don't have to cost a lot.
sentences.chinese: 买礼物不必破费太多，选有意义的即可。

sentences.english: Learning any language takes a lot of effort. but dont give up.
sentences.chinese: 学习任何言语都是需求破费很多努力，但不要保持。

sentences.english: Some of the most generous and romantic gifts cost nothing in terms of dollars and cents.
sentences.chinese: 有些最慷慨最浪漫的礼物并不需要破费分毫。

sentences.english: About sex, the pleasure is momentary, the position ridiculous and the expense damnable.
sentences.chinese: 快感只要那么一瞬间，而付出的破费却是惊人的。

definition: to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
Don't get a reward if it's not deserved. (idiom)
to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
to regard sb as an outsider
to let sb down/to be unfair/I'm sorry/pardon me (formal)
to dip into one's pocket/to pay out of pocket/to foot the bill
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
I appreciate your kindness (conventional reply to turn down an offer)
